marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Holds Interest Rate as Expected
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (19 March) decided to keep the benchmark BI Rate at 5.75%, in line with consensus expectations. Governor Perry Warjiyo said that although there is room for a rate cut, the current global conditions do not allow it yet. He added that BI will monitor exchange rate movements, inflation, and economic growth before taking further action. The decision came one day after the IDX fell on Tuesday (18 March), which was partly driven by market concerns over Indonesia's economic outlook. Responding to those concerns, Perry said the market reaction was "more driven by technical factors" such as global tariff worries, and that Indonesian assets remain fundamentally attractive. Perry noted that BI maintains the same growth and inflation outlook presented at the Governors' Board meeting in January 2025. As context, BI had lowered the 2025 growth outlook from a range of +4.8-5.6% YoY to +4.7-5.5% YoY in that meeting. Following the rate decision, the rupiah weakened 0.6% to 16,525 per US dollar on Wednesday, while the IDX closed up 1.42% and the 10-year government bond yield rose 6 basis points to 7.09%. The rupiah has depreciated 1.2% month-on-month against the dollar. Going forward, BI expects the rupiah to strengthen on fundamentals, based on an attractive yield differential for investors. BI will continue foreign-exchange market interventions to keep the rate aligned with economic fundamentals. BI still expects the US Federal Reserve to cut rates by 25 basis points in 2025, driven by tariff-related recession concerns in the United States, but Perry cautioned that the Fed will not rush to cut given current uncertainties and a slowing disinflation process in the US.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although the decision to keep the BI Rate matched the consensus of economists, Bloomberg noted that 8 of 25 economists expect BI to cut rates today, partly to boost the economy. Recent concerns include a 0.09% YoY deflation in February 2025 and the earlier reduction of the growth outlook by BI. Eighteen of 32 economists anticipate a further 50-basis-point cut in 2025, while 11 of 32 expect only a 25-basis-point cut by year-end. Investors should watch: the US Fed rate decision on Wednesday (19 March), where the CME FedWatch Tool shows a 99% probability that the Fed will keep rates unchanged; and the Indonesian government's execution of programs to stimulate growth and improve investor confidence.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Slowing Bank Credit Growth
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that bank credit growth slowed to +10.3% YoY in the second month of 2025 (2M25) versus +10.27% YoY in the first month (1M25), below the 2025 target range of +11-13%. Investment credit grew +14.62% YoY, consumer credit +10.31% YoY, and working-capital credit +7.66% YoY. Sharia financing grew +9.15% YoY and MSME credit grew +2.51% YoY.

marketNews.title: OJK Announces Buyback Rule
marketNews.content: On Wednesday (19 March) the Financial Services Authority (OJK) announced a regulation allowing issuers to conduct share buybacks without shareholder meeting approval, as a measure to mitigate market volatility. The rule is effective for six months starting 18 March 2025.

marketNews.title: Congo Plans Cooperation with Indonesia on Cobalt
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Democratic Republic of Congo plans to seek cooperation with Indonesia to better control global cobalt supply and prices. The DRC, the world's largest cobalt producer, suspended cobalt exports for four months at the end of February 2025 to support prices. Indonesia's cobalt supply share rose to 11% of global supply in 2024, according to Darton Commodities.

marketNews.title: Fujian Province Investment Plan
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto claimed that Fujian Province in China plans to invest 16 trillion rupiah in the Batang Integrated Industrial Estate in Central Java. The investment was discussed during a meeting between President Prabowo Subianto and Chinese President Xi Jinping.

marketNews.title: OJK Says No Immediate Review of Trading Halt Policy
marketNews.content: The Head of Capital Market Supervision, Derivatives, and Carbon Exchange at OJK, Inarno Djajadi, said the regulator will not evaluate the trading-halt policy yet. BEI Director Irvan Susandy added that while feedback has been received, trading halts are common practice on other exchanges. Their statements followed Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto's comment on Tuesday (18 March) that the trading-halt policy should be reviewed when the IDX falls 5%.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Shares Bought by Petrindo Jaya Kreasi via PT Kreasi Jasa Persada
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($PTRO) through its subsidiary PT Kreasi Jasa Persada purchased approximately 72.1 million PTRO shares at an average price of 3,433 rupiah per share on 17 March 2025. The transaction value was about 247.5 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 43.519% to 44.234%.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy Stake Increased by Prajogo Pangestu
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN) controlled by Prajogo Pangestu purchased approximately 1.8 million BREN shares at an average price of 4,987 rupiah per share on 18 March 2025. The transaction value was about 8.8 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's direct ownership in BREN rose from 0.09993% to 0.10125%.

tickerNews.title: Grab Merger Talks with GoTo Remain Unconfirmed
tickerNews.content: The Singapore Competition and Consumer Commission said it has not received any notification from Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) or GoTo Gojek Tokopedia regarding a proposed merger. GoTo reiterated on Wednesday (19 March) that there is no agreement with any party concerning a potential transaction with Grab. Earlier, Bloomberg reported that Grab had started due diligence to acquire GoTo. If combined, Grab and GoTo would control almost 90% of the online transport market in Singapore and over 91% in Indonesia, according to Euromonitor International.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia Considers US$1.2 Billion Loan for New Mining Projects
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia's CEO, Febriany Eddy, said the company is considering a bank loan at the end of 2025 or in 2026 to fund strategic projects. Earlier, INCO's Head of Corporate Communications, Vanda Kusumaningrum, stated in December 2024 that the company was targeting a US$1.2 billion loan to develop new mining projects in 2025. Vale Indonesia is currently working on three new mines in the Pomalaa, Morowali, and Sorowako blocks.

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak Reports Negative Adjusted EBITDA in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak ($BUKA) recorded adjusted EBITDA of negative 147 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (versus negative 167 billion in 3Q24 and negative 46 billion in 4Q23). The annual adjusted EBITDA for 2024 was negative 340 billion rupiah (versus negative 475 billion in 2023). Revenue in 4Q24 was 1.1 trillion rupiah (versus 987 billion in 3Q24 and 1.1 trillion in 4Q23). Contribution margin in 4Q24 was 41 billion rupiah (versus 61 billion in 3Q24 and 122 billion in 4Q23). After the 2Q24 results, management cancelled the 2024 guidance. Quarterly revenue was flat, and margin contribution declined quarter-on-quarter.

tickerNews.title: Charoen Pokphand Indonesia Posts 114% QoQ Net Profit Growth in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: Charoen Pokphand Indonesia ($CPIN) reported net profit of 1.3 trillion rupiah in 4Q24, a 114% quarter-on-quarter increase, reversing a loss of 357 billion rupiah in 4Q23. Annual net profit for 2024 reached 3.7 trillion rupiah, a 60% year-on-year increase, beating Stockbit's estimate (98% of forecast) and exceeding consensus (115% of forecast). The profit surge was driven mainly by improvements in the broiler segment and continued strength in the feed segment. Throughout 2024, net profit was supported by higher operating margins in the broiler and DOC segments, which turned profitable after losses in 2023.

tickerNews.title: AKR Corporindo Reports 756bn Net Profit in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo ($AKRA) posted net profit of 756 billion rupiah in 4Q24, a 32% year-on-year decline but a 53% quarter-on-quarter increase. Annual net profit for 2024 was 2.2 trillion rupiah, down 20% YoY and 96% of consensus estimates. Quarterly recovery was driven by normalization in the Trade & Distribution segment, which grew 51% QoQ in 4Q24, although it remained down 14% YoY. The segment's annual decline was due to price normalization and weather-related volume disruptions in the mining sector. AKRA sold 38 hectares of industrial land in 2024, a 58% YoY decline, below the target of 100 hectares. Nevertheless, AKRA maintains a 2025 target of selling 100 hectares of JIIPE land, supported by backlog contracts from 2024.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in Surya Citra Media (SCMA)
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK) purchased approximately 379.3 million shares of Surya Citra Media at an average price of 197 rupiah per share between 6 and 18 March 2025, for a total transaction value of about 75 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA rose from 62.82% to 63.33%.

tickerNews.title: Energi Mega Persada Secures $42 Million Credit Facility from Bank Mandiri
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada ($ENRG), through its subsidiary PT EMP Energi Jaya, signed a credit facility of up to 42 million US dollars from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) to finance cash-flow gaps and working-capital needs.

tickerNews.title: Fast Food Indonesia Plans Private Placement of ~533 Million New Shares
tickerNews.content: Fast Food Indonesia ($FAST) intends to conduct a private placement of approximately 533 million new shares at an execution price of 150 rupiah per share, resulting in an estimated dilution of 11.79%. The placement will be subscribed by the controlling shareholder PT Gelael Pratama and Indoritel Makmur Internasional ($DNET). The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 24 April 2025.
